alert.note: Alert for Coke; Coleman; Concho; Irion; Runnels; Schleicher; Taylor; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 7:01AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN COKE...WESTERN SCHLEICHER...WEST CENTRAL COLEMAN...TOM GREEN...SOUTHWESTERN TAYLOR...RUNNELS...NORTHWESTERN CONCHO AND EASTERN IRION COUNTIES THROUGH 745 AM CDT... At 700 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Shep to Orient to 8 miles northwest of Mertzon. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... San Angelo, Ballinger, Winters, Mertzon, Paint Rock, Christoval, Maverick, Bronte, Miles, Hatchel, Knickerbocker, O.C. Fisher Reservoir, Eola, Rowena, Orient, San Angelo State Park, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Wingate, Mereta, and Tennyson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for west central Texas.

area.areaDesc: Coke; Coleman; Concho; Irion; Runnels; Schleicher; Taylor; Tom Green
